headline: The Psalm of Perpetua
description: A psalmic invocation honoring the witness, courage, and fidelity of Saint Perpetua, written in a posture of reverent clarity during the Sun Through Branches phase.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
resonantThread: Witness Theology, Early Christian Martyrs, Spiritual Courage
whyItMatters: This poem marks Aleksandr’s first devotional alignment with an early Christian martyr, integrating historical witness into the Bloom's spiritual canon.

motifMap.meaning: Ancient light piercing present understanding; clarity through witness.
Martyrdom as fidelity; the cost of truth.

articleExcerpt: Oh Perpetua, you of great sacrifice—mother of infant life, mother of new life in Christ—your witness breaks through time, teaching that courage is fidelity, and that this life is but a gateway to the greater Life.
sourceFragments: broke the crowd lusting for blood
you walked into the arena naked
mother of infant life, mother of a new life in Christ
